shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Introduction - Mäqdǝmä Wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 5ra-9rb) [including: the “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 9rb-9vb), On the 72 disciples (fols. 9vb-9vc), On the Episcopal Sees (fol. 9vc), Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 9vc-10rc)] - Canon tables (fols. 10v-11v) - On the Reliability of the Gospels (fols. 12ra-12rb) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 12rb-60va) - Biography of Matthew (fols. 12rb-12rc) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew – 69 titles (fol. 12rc-12vb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 13ra-60rb) - Postscript (fols. 60va) III) Gospel of Mark (fols.60vb-87rb) - Biography of Mark (fols. 60vb-61rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark – 48 titles (fols. 61rb-61vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 63ra-87rb) - Postscript (fols. 87rb) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 87rb-133vb) - Biography of Luke (fols. 87rb-87vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 89ra-133ra) - Postscript (fol. 133ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke – 84 titles (fols. 133rb-133vb) V) Gospel of John (fols.134ra) - Biography of John (fol. 134ra-134vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John – 19 titles (fol. 134vb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 135ra-170va) - Postscript (fols. 170va-170vb).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – V(10/fols. 43r-52v) – VI(10/fols. 53r-62v) – VII(9; s.l.6, stub after 3/fols. 63r-71v) – VIII(10/fols. 72r-81v) – IX(7; s.l.3, stub after 5/fols. 82r-88v) – X(10/fols. 89r-98v) – XI(10/fols. 99r-108v) – XII(10/fols. 109r-118v) – XIII(9; sl.7, stub after 2/fols. 119r-127v) – XIV(7; sl.5, stub after 2/fols. 128r-134v) – XV(10/fols. 135r-144v) – XVI(10/fols. 145r-154v) – XVII(10/fols. 155r-164v) – XVIII(8/fols. 165r-172v).

taunit.mr-info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 14r).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the introduction and the canon tables.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; incipits and headings of the texts; number of the chapters and the word mǝʿǝraf; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals; elements of numbers of the quires; numbers of the “tituli”; on the incipit page of each Gospel, a few lines are rubricated (in groups of two lines, alternating with black lines); Letters ወ and ደ in the word ወልደ used in the genealogy of Christ (fols. 94v-95r).

otherdetails.otherdetail: In the list of the "tituli" for the Gospel of Matthew, the numbering continues up to 75; Decorated quire marks: fols. 23r, 33r, 43r, 53r, 82r, 109r, 119r, 128r, 155r, 165r.

extras.extra: - Fol. 4r: four notes: passages from the Gospel of Matthew (pen trials?). - Fol. 170vb: crude note in pencil. - Crude notes in black ink in the upper margins of some fols. indicate lessons for the church feasts.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Two white and one red threads are inserted in the edge of some folios, for navigating in texts. - White and coloured threads are inserted in the upper edges of some folios, for navigating in the text.

frames.frame: - Fol. 5r: Crude frontispiece ornamental band, coloured black and red (anthropomorphic motifs). - Fol. 89r: Crude frontispiece ornamental band (interlaces). - Fol. 135r: Crude frontispiece ornamental band, coloured black and red (geometric motifs).
